projects.title: ScanITÂ©
projects.description: I designed and developed an Android barcode scanning application enriched with price comparison and shopping cart functionalities, revolutionizing the way users effortlessly compare prices across various stores. This app seamlessly integrated data analysis and openAI APIs to offer personalized product recommendations while keeping tabs on user preferences for their favorite stores. To enhance the overall user experience, I also incorporated features that allow users to save their preferred products, craft shopping lists, and jot down notes for future purchases. This dynamic solution was realized through the utilization of Android Studio, Java, FireBase, Rapid APIs, and the openAI API, resulting in a feature-rich and user-centric mobile experience.

projects.title: SJSU pantry application
projects.description: Developing a web application aimed at providing students at SJSU with convenient access to the communal pantry. With this app, students can easily place orders and reserve time slots for picking up their items, effectively eliminating the need to endure long wait queues. Additionally, this application offers a streamlined solution for volunteers to efficiently manage inventory. To bring this project to life, I'm utilizing technologies such as Spring Boot, ReactJS, and MongoDB, ensuring a user-friendly and efficient system for both students and volunteers.

projects.title: IDENTIFYING FAKE REVIEWS
projects.description: I embarked on a project aimed at detecting fraudulent product reviews generated by various spamming groups. To combat this issue, I devised a sophisticated model that identifies these spammers and rectifies product ratings by eliminating the counterfeit reviews and ratings. This innovative solution was crafted using a combination of Python, MATLAB, and MySQL, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the review system while maintaining the integrity of product evaluations.
